result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Steven Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
STRAIGHT TIME; NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES; credit for 18 days time served; STAYED and placed on Probatrion.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

miscConds.notes: No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

6 MONTHS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 5 MONTHS for the third violation.
- Comply with mental health treatment, and take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete 60 hours of community service at a non-profit organization.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments.  Cash bail to apply.  Balance to be returned to poster.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

timeConds.notes: STAYED CONSECUTIVE/to be used by agent for any violations. Defendant shall serve 10 days for first violation; 20 days for second violation and 5 months for third violation.

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 06/09/14. AR

Defendant Edward Steven Robinson in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 18 days served. 
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- 6 MONTHS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 5 MONTHS for the third violation.
- Comply with mental health treatment, and take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete 60 hours of community service at a non-profit organization.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments.  Cash bail to apply.  Balance to be returned to poster.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

  Per Chief Judge Directive 06-01A, this case is reassigned to Judge       for Reconfinement Review Hearing.  Reconfinement Review from the Department of Corrections, filed.  mjs

Received and filed.

Count 1:  Possession of Narcotic Drugs, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(am), 939.50(3)(i).  A class I felony.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Edward Steven Robinson in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  
Court will allow defendant to be released on GPS for meeting with lawyer, Aurora Advance Health on May 13, and mental health treatment at Milwaukee Health Services.  Defendant to provide verification.  Next court date remains for plea and sentencing on 6/3/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Notice of motion and motion for review and modification of bond, received and filed.  aw
Defense counsel requests a bail bond hearing to address defendant's GPS.  Case adjourned for bail bond hearing on 5/7/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw

Defendant Edward Steven Robinson in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs for Megan L. Morrisey.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Nicole Pritzlaff.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing on June 3, 2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 3.

Defendant Edward Steven Robinson in court with attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons for attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
NO FILE IN COURT.
Court addresses violation report.  Defendant tested positive for opiates and oxycodone.  Defendant warned.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court informs the defendant that bail will be modified if he continues to test positive.  Defendant to continue to go to Justice Point once per week.

Court will also allow the defendant to go to an assessment on 4/11/2014 at Acacia Mental Health Clinic, and be released for treatment if verified.  Case remains scheduled for plea and sentencing on 6/3/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Edward Steven Robinson in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/3/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
14RM015218  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 3/14/14
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Edward Steven Robinson in court with attorney Christian Eichenlaub for Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Edward Steven Robinson in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Edward Steven Robinson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Edward Steven Robinson in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Deputy Court Clerk:  bm for hgj
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
